TestDescription.name: MySQL 5.1 to 5.1.18 multiple vulnerabilities
TestDescription.Description: The remote database server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities. [break] 1. Evaluation of an 'IN()' predicate with a decimal-valued argument causes a service crash. [break] 2. A user can rename a table even though he does not have DROP privileges. [break] 3. If a stored routine is declared as 'SQL SECURITY INVOKER', a user may be able to gain privileges by invoking that routine. [break] 4. A user with only ALTER privileges on a partitioned table can discover information about the table that should require SELECT privileges.
TestDescription.Impact: 1. Evaluation of an 'IN()' predicate with a decimal-valued argument causes a service crash. [break] 2. A user can rename a table even though he does not have DROP privileges. [break] 3. If a stored routine is declared as 'SQL SECURITY INVOKER', a user may be able to gain privileges by invoking that routine. [break] 4. A user with only ALTER privileges on a partitioned table can discover information about the table that should require SELECT privileges. [break]
TestDescription.Recommendation: Upgrade to MySQL version 5.1.18 or later.
